title.native: ささやくように恋を唄う
title.romaji: Sasayaku You ni Koi wo Utau

description:
After performing a song at her school’s opening ceremony, musician Yori Asanagi receives an apparent love confession from freshman Himari Kino. But just as Yori decides she wants to return Himari’s feelings, Himari reveals that she did not “love” her, but “admires” her! But you can’t unring a bell once struck, and Yori is determined to make Himari fall for her, not just her music. Will their hearts ever beat as one, or will their love fall out of tune?

(Source: HIDIVE)
synonyms: กระซิบรักเป็นทำนองร้องบอกเธอ

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Band
tags.description: Main cast is a group of musicians.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Rock Music
tags.description: Centers on the musical style of rock, not to be applied to anime that use rock in its soundtrack.

tags.name: Aromantic
tags.description: Features a character who experiences little to no romantic attraction.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

node.description:
__[Archived Profile (Smile Company)](https://www.smile-co.jp/archives/creator/425)__

__Hiroshi Sasaki__ is a Japanese lyricist, composer and arranger formerly affiliated with Smile Company.
Japanese composer and arranger. Member of [eyelis](https://anilist.co/staff/115190/Eyelis).

Shouko Fujibayashi is a Japanese lyricist and musician. Shouko has written the lyrics for many television series' theme songs as well as several theme songs for tokusatsu shows. Most recently, Fujibayashi has worked with Shuhei Naruse on the sountracks of Kamen Rider Den-O, Kamen Rider Kiva, and their films respectively. She also worked with BoA, Ken Hirai, Sowelu, Mikuni Shimokawa, Crystal Kay, Beni Arashiro, ISSA of DA PUMP, Lead and Miho Kanno. Shouko made her debut in 1995 with Wonderful Bravo, an image song for the anime TV series, Gokudou-kun. She works for Office Two-One.

__[Website](https://www.peakasoul.net/kurosu) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/krossy)__

__Katsuhiko Kurosu__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and member of the music production team [Q-MHz](https://anilist.co/staff/156926).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/watanabesho)__ | __[Blog (jp)](https://ameblo.jp/shoooou/)__ | __[Artist Profile (Smile Company)](https://www.smile-co.jp/archives/creator/431)__

Shou Watanabe is a Japanese keyboardist, lyricist, composer, arranger and member of three-piece rock band [Sajou no Hana](https://anilist.co/staff/137163/).

__[Website](http://takuyawatanabe.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/takuya88699231)__

__Birthplace:__ Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan

__Takuya Watanabe__ is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, music producer and guitarist.

__[Website](https://www.peakasoul.net/kurosu) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/krossy)__

__Katsuhiko Kurosu__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and member of the music production team [Q-MHz](https://anilist.co/staff/156926).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/watanabesho)__ | __[Blog (jp)](https://ameblo.jp/shoooou/)__ | __[Artist Profile (Smile Company)](https://www.smile-co.jp/archives/creator/431)__

Shou Watanabe is a Japanese keyboardist, lyricist, composer, arranger and member of three-piece rock band [Sajou no Hana](https://anilist.co/staff/137163/).
